metadata.title: CVE-2011-3885 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in Google Chrome before 15.0.874.102 allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecifiedother impact via vectors related to stale Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)token-sequence data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-3885` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-1.0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-1.0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '15.0.874.102~r106587-0ubuntu1').
webkitgtk package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.8-1ubuntu1~ubuntu14.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
